page.title: 01Customs
page.content: There are a few customs in the grid squares we were given. In Aust there is a fete and a whist drive once a year, which is when people gather to play card games. Also there is a time when the "Young Farmers Club" bless the plough so that it will churn good soil and make the crops plentiful. This meeting takes place annually. Around Mill Farm there is an open-air fair for the harvest, once a year in the Summer. Also in the local church of St Thomas there is a service where gifts are offered. Also in our area there are some barn-dances. This occasion is very traditional and goes back along way through the centuries. It takes place in a barn, and is held once every three weeks. The barn-dance is enjoyed by the local people.
